result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany Marie Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Court granted Huber privileges for work and treatment

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school).
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffany Marie Reed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tiffany Marie Reed in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 89 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and treatment.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 20 hours of work per week if in school). 

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 7-27-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 7-21-22

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Tiffany Marie Reed not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defendant not produced.  Court rescheduled the matter upon request from the parties.  State will file an order to produce.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Tiffany Marie Reed not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered the defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Tiffany Marie Reed not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Bail motion by Defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for a status in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tiffany Marie Reed in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Defendant Tiffany Marie Reed in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Walmart Supercenter, 6701 S. 27th St. Fanklin, WI
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Tiffany Marie Reed in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Tiffany Marie Reed in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
